sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 72 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72, the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2, or one of the 51 non-abelian groups of order 72.
message_1: How many non-abelian groups of order 72 are there according to Group Theory, and what are their names?
message_2:
There are 9 non-abelian groups of order 72 according to Group Theory. Their names are as follows:

1. S_3 × Z_4 × Z_3
2. S_3 × Z_12
3. S_3 × (Z_4 × Z_3) ⋊ Z_2
4. (S_3 × Z_4) ⋊ Z_3
5. (S_3 × Z_3) ⋊ Z_4
6. S_3 × Z_4 ⋊ Z_3
7. S_3 × Z_3 ⋊ Z_4
8. S_3 × D_12
9. S_3 × Q_12

Here, S_3 represents the symmetric group of degree 3, Z_n represents the cyclic group of order n, D_n represents the dihedral group of order 2n, Q_n represents the quaternion group of order 4n, and ⋊ denotes a semidirect product.
